page.title: 05Earley Farm,East Sussex
page.content: Earley Farm is a very old farm, probably built before 1066.It has a brick floor in the kitchen laid on sand.It has plenty of fields around it for all the cows,sheep and crops that the owner has.The farm does not specialise in any particular type of farming so it is a mixed farm.The farmer breeds cows for milk and cattle for beef.The cows produce 1000 gallons of milk annually. The farmer breeds pure Freesian heifers for milking cows.He cross breeds them sometimes with his Hereford bull to poduce beef calves to sell them to another farmer for fattening,then they are sold at Heathfield market.The farmer also breeds sheep.He has around 220 Kent ewes and 5 Dorset Down rams.In 1985,200 lambs were born which was less than normal because of the hard winter.
